The Engine was built for this project specifically. For this project I used what I've learnt the past months and focused on the projects architecture, and also som fun optimisation solutions. This was done through seperation of project solutions, and Backface Culling. This is my ongoing side project.

Backface Culling

It calls an addVoxel function for each tile while generating the grid. This function checks the height based on a perlin noise, it then checks this height compared to its neighbours. Depending on the neighbours height difference it removes and adds quads to the voxels.

Showcase of the trees spawned ontop of the voxel terrain.

Tree Instantiation

The generation uses two perlin noises. One for the voxel terrain and one to determine where the trees should be instantiated. The trees then uses the same perlin noise as the voxel terrain to determine its height in the world, resulting in the trees being neatly placed ontop of the terrain.

Architectural Structure

The project uses two project solutions. One solution for the general game engine logic, while the other one strictly handles the actual rendering part of the project.
